formula:
For most of the questions in this topic, two or more linear equations will be obtained. Solve those equations to get the answer.

Example:

10 years ago, a father was four times as old as his son. 10 years hence, he will be twice as old his son. Find the son's present age.

Solution:

Let the father's present age be F and the son's age be S.

10 years ago:
(F-10)=4(S-10)
F-10 = 4S-40
F=4S-30
10 years hence:
(F+10)=2(S+10)
F+10=2S+20
F-2S=10
Replacing F with 4S-30,
(4S-30)-2S=10
2S=40
S=20
Son's present age=20 years

problems.question: The ratio of the ages of A and B is 2:3. If B is 3 years elder than A, find the age of A after 2 years.
problems.solution:
Let the ages of A and B be 2x and 3x respectively.

3x=2x+3
A=2x=6 
B=3x=9

Age of A after 2 years is 8.

problems.question: Two years ago, Harish was thrice as old as his brother Krish. Two years later, Harish will be twice as old as Krish. Find the present age of Krish.
problems.solution:
H-2=3*(K-2)
H+2=2*(K+2)
Solving the equations, K=6

problems.question: In a family of four, the average age is 20. The parents' age difference is 6 and the siblings' age difference is 4. If the ages of the eldest and youngest member differ by 33, find the age of the youngest member of the family.
problems.solution:
Let the age of the parents be x and x+6.
Let the age of the siblings be y and y+4.

x+6-y=33
(x+x+6+y+y+4)/4 = 20

Solving the equations,  y=4

problems.question: Ram is 5 years elder than Lakshman who is 4 years elder than Bharath. The sum of their ages is 61. Find the age of Lakshman.
problems.solution:
R=L+5
L=B+4
R+L+B=61
Solving the three equations, L=20

problems.question: The sum of the ages of a mother and a son is equal to the age of the father. Three years later, the father will be six times as old as his son. The ratio of the present ages of the mother and son is 10:1. Find the age of the father.
problems.solution:
M+S=F
F+3=6(S+3)
M/S = 10
Solving these equations, F = 33

problems.question: Ram and Raj are twins. The sum of their ages combined with their father's age is 47. Their father's age at the time of their birth was 29. Find the age of Ram.
problems.solution:
R+R+F=47
F-R=29
Solving the two equations, R=6

problems.question: Thirteen years back, my mother was thrice my age and two years back, she was twice my age. Find my mother's present age.
problems.solution:
Let my age be x and my mother's age be y.
y-13 = 3(x-13)
y-2 = 2(x-2)
Solving the two equations, y=46

problems.question: A man has three daughters. The present ages of all three of them are square numbers. The sum of their ages after 5 years is 41. Find the age of his eldest daughter after 2 years.
problems.solution:
x,y and z are square numbers.
(x+5)+(y+5)+(z+5)=41
x+y+z=26
By trial and error method, their ages are 1, 9 and 16.

The age of his eldest daughter after 2 years is 18.

problems.question: A wizard named Nepo says "I am only three times my son's age. My father is 40 years more than twice my age. Together the three of us are a mere 1240 years old." How old is Nepo?
problems.solution:
N=3S
F=2N+40
F+N+S=1240
Solving these, N=360

problems.question: A father is three times as old as his son. After fifteen years the father will be twice as old as his son's age at that time. Hence the father's present age is
problems.solution:
F=3S
F+15=2(S+15)
Solving the two equations, F=45

problems.question: On a man's tombstone, it is said that one sixth of his life was spent in childhood and one twelfth as a teenager. One seventh of his life passed between the time he became an adult and the time he married; five years later, his son was born. Alas, the son died four years before he did. He lived to be twice as old as his son did. How old did the man live to be?
problems.solution:
Let the man's age be x years and his son's age be y years.

(x/6)+(x/12)+(x/7)+5+y+4=x
x=2y
Solving, x=84

problems.question: In a group of 4 friends, P is the eldest and R is the youngest. Neither is of the same age as the others. The sum of the ages of R and S is greater than twice the age of Q. Who is the second eldest?
problems.solution:
R+S>2Q
Q<R+S/2
Since R<Q,  S>Q

R<Q<S<P

problems.question: At present, Shyam is twice as old as his sister. Three years back, he was thrice her age. Find his sister's present age.
problems.solution:
Let his sister's present age be x.

Shyam's present age = 2x

2x-3 = 3(x-3)

x = 6

problems.question: Today is Anish's birthday. One year from today, he will be twice as old as he was 10 years ago. How old is Anish today?
problems.solution:
Let his present age be x.

x+1 = 2(x-10)

Solving, x = 21

problems.question: The present ages of Ram and Raj differ by 7. Five years back, Raj was twice the age of Ram. Find the age of Ram after 4 years.
problems.solution:
Let Raj's age be x and Ram's age be y.
x-y=7
x-5=2(y-5)
Solving the two linear equations, 
y=12,y+4=16

problems.question: Anju is three years older than Sanju who is five years older than Manju. The sum of their ages is 73. Find the age of Sanju.
5 years ago, 1/5th of Keith's age was equal to 1/7th of Dora's age. The average of their present ages is 29. Find Keith's age after 5 years.
The average age of two brothers in a family is 21. The average drops to 19 when the age of the third brother is also included. Find the age of the third brother.
problems.solution:
Let the ages of the three brothers be x,y and z.

(x+y)/2 = 21
x+y=42

(x+y+z)/3=19

x+y+z=57

42+z=57

z=15

problems.question: The difference between the ages of A and C is half the age of B. The difference between the ages of A and B is one-sixth of the age of C. If the sum of the ages of B and C is 32, find the age of A.
problems.solution:
A-C=B/2

A-B=C/6

B+C=32

Solving the three equations,
A=22

problems.question: The present ages of three people in a family are in the ratio 3:5:7. If the sum of their ages before 5 years was 60, find the age of the youngest.
problems.solution:
Let their present ages be 3x,5x and 7x.

Sum of their ages before 5 years
= 3x-5+5x-5+7x-5
= 15x-15 = 60
Solving,
x=5
Age of the youngest
= 3x = 15

problems.question: The ratio of the ages of a mother and a daughter are in the ratio 3:1. The product of their ages is 363. Find the daughter's age after 4 years.
problems.solution:
Mother's present age = 3x
Daughter's present age = x

3x*x = 363

3x² = 363

x² = 121

x = 11

Daughter's age after 4 years = 15

problems.question: A father's age is two and a half times more than his son's age. 5 years ago, he was six times the age of his son. Find the father's present age.
problems.solution:
Let the son's present age be x years.

Father's age
= x+2.5x
= 3.5x
(3.5x-5) = 6(x-5)

3.5x-5=6x-30

2.5x=25

x=10

Father's present age = 35

problems.question: A boy said to his friends, "When I was born, my father was as old as I am now". If his father's age will be 60 after 6 years, find the son's present age.
problems.solution:
Father's present age
= 60-6
= 54
Let the son's present age be x years.

The father was x years old when the son was born(before x years).

54-x = x

x = 27

problems.question: The ages of Pooja and Deepa are in the ratio 4:5. 4 years ago, their ages were in the ratio 8:11. Find Pooja's present age.
problems.solution:
Pooja's present age=4x
Deepa's present age=5x

(4x-4):(5x-4) = 8:11

44x-44=40x-32

4x=12

x=3

4x=12

problems.question: Nina is 9 years older than Angel. Two years ago, Angel's age was half that of Nina's. Find Angel's present age.
Flora is twice Tara's age. After 10 years, Tara will be two-third of Flora's age. Find Flora's present age.
Five years ago, the sum of my age and my mother's age was equal to my father's age. If my father is 6 years elder than my mother, find my present age.
problems.solution:
Let my present age be X.

(X-5)+(M-5)=(F-5)
X+M=F+5
X=F-M+5

F-M=6
X=6+5=11

problems.solution:
Let the present ages of A, B and C be 3x, 5x and 8x respectively.

(3x-8)+(5x-8)+(8x-8)
= 40
16x-24=40

2x-3=5

x=8/2 = 4

problems.question: My brother is 5 years elder to me. My father was 30 years of age when my sister was born while my mother was 32 years of age when I was born. If my sister was 5 years of age when my brother was born, then what was the age my father when my brother was born?
problems.solution:
Let my present age be x.
Brother's age = x+5
My sister is five years elder than my brother.
Sister's age = x+10
My father was 30 years of age when my sister was born.
Father's age
= x+10+30
= x+40
My mother was 32 years of age when I was born.
Mother's age
= x+32
Father's age when my brother was born
= x+40-(x+5)
= 35

problems.question: Ajay's father was 32 years of age when he was born while his mother was 29 years old when his sister three years younger to him was born. What is the difference between the ages of his parents?
problems.solution:
Let Ajay's age be x.

His father's age
= x+32
His sister's age
= x-3
His mother's age
= x-3+29
= x+26
Difference between the ages of his parents
= (x+32)-(x+26)
= 6

The ratio of the age of a man & his wife is 4:3. After 4 years, this ratio will be 9:7. If at the time of marriage, the ratio was 7:5, then how many years ago were they married?

(4x+4):(3x+4) = 9:7

7(4x+4) = 9(3x+4)

x = 8

m = 32
w=24

Lets assume they were married y years ago.

(32-y):(24-y) = 7:5

y = 4

problems.question: Q is as much younger than R as he is older than T. If the sum of the ages of R and T is 50 years, find the difference between the ages of R and Q.
problems.solution:
R - Q = Q - T

(R + T) = 2Q

Now given that, (R + T) = 50

2Q = 50
Q = 25

Without knowing the value of R or T, we can't find R-Q. Hence, Data Inadequate.

problems.question: The total of the ages of X, Y and Z at present is 90 years. Ten years ago, the ratio of their ages was 1: 2: 3. What is the age of Y at present?
problems.solution:
Ten years ago,
Ratio of ages of X, Y and Z = 1:2:3

Let the ages of X, Y and Z, ten years ago be k, 2k and 3k.

Sum of their present ages = 90

k+10 +2k+10 +3k+10 = 90

6k = 60

k = 10

Present age of Y = 2k+10 = 30

problems.question: The average age of 10 students is 20 years. If the age of one more student is included, the average decreases by 1. What is the age of the new student?

Average age of 10 students
= 20
Sum of the ages of the 10 students
= 10*20 = 200
Let the age of the new student be x.
The new average = 20-1 = 19

200+x = 19*11

x = 9

problems.question:
The sum of the ages of A, B and C is 96 years. To find the age of B, which of the following information given in the statements P and Q is/are sufficient?

P  : A is 6 years older than C.
Q : The sum of the ages of B and C is 56 years.
problems.solution:
Given
A+B+C = 96

P:
A = C+6

Q:
B+C = 56

Both the statements P and Q are needed to find the age of B.

problems.solution:
